content.description: Star Fish is a great, little route with nice moves. Start on the obvious roof on the center wall. Pull the roof, and traverse slightly right into the broken, thin crack. Move up following the crack and avoiding the easier terrain on the left. The crux is the final move before topping out to the right of the crack.
content.protection: The gear is thin! Pulling the roof at the start takes a nice 0.75, then it thins out at you move up. I was able to place a 0.2, 0.3 x4, a #1, a #2 wallnut in the middle, and a nice 0.5 to protect the crux. Building the anchor will also take thin gear.
content.location:
Start by pulling the roof on the "

Center Route

."

content.description:
This is a great crack climb that climbs fists to thin hands if done purely.

It is a great corner climb for you bouldering types.
content.protection: One #3 and one #1 Camalot will suffice.

content.description:
The center routes all go around 5.6 to 5.7. I'm sure you could get wild and makes things difficult, but this is the grade.

These are great solos or a good place for beginners to settle those nerves.

This is the smooth, cool looking dihedral on the left side of the crag to the right of '

Left Crack

'. The crux is around the middle reaching for a jug on the arete. Try staying directly on the smooth face and going straight up.
content.protection: It is easy to set up a toprope.
content.location:
It is on the left side of the crag to the right of the '

Left Crack

.'
